::: {.question}

**Equity Issuance Under Asymmetric Information**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false

set.seed(907)
library(webexercises)
library(knitr)

# True firm value known only by managers
true_value <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 220, sd = 8), 2)
market_belief <- round(true_value - runif(1, 10, 30), 2)

shares_outstanding <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 10, sd = 0.5), 2)

# Market price based on belief
market_price <- round(market_belief / shares_outstanding, 2)

# Firm needs financing
capital_needed <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 40, sd = 3), 2)

shares_issued <- round(capital_needed / market_price, 2)

# True post-money equity value per share
price_after = round(true_value / (shares_outstanding + shares_issued), 2)
```

A firm has `r shares_outstanding`M shares outstanding. Managers know the true total value is `r true_value`M, but the market believes it is only `r market_belief`M. The firm needs to raise `r capital_needed`M immediately and issues equity at the market price.

Compute:

(a) the market price per share

(b) the number of shares the firm must issue

(c) the true value per share after the issue (millions)
